content.question: Which of the following progressions includes a correct realization of the iii chord?

choices.label: Three chords in G major. Chord 1 is G2, B3, D4, and G4. Chord 2 is B2, B3, D4, and F-sharp4. Chord 3 is C3, G3, C4, and E4.
Three chords in G major. Chord 1 is G2, B3, G4, and D5. Chord 2 is B2, D4, G4, and D5. Chord 3 is C3, C4, G4, and E5.
Three chords in G major. Chord 1 is G2, D4, G4, and B4. Chord 2 is B2, D4, G4, and D5. Chord 3 is F-sharp3, D4, F-sharp4, and D5.
Three chords in G major. Chord 1 is G2, D4, G4, and B4. Chord 2 is B2, D4, G4, and B4. Chord 3 is G2, D4, G4, and B4.

content.answer: Three chords in G major. Chord 1 is G2, B3, D4, and G4. Chord 2 is B2, B3, D4, and F-sharp4. Chord 3 is C3, G3, C4, and E4.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in notated music.
